subject: Economics
title: Supply Chains: The Invisible Networks Behind Everything You Own
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Supply Chains: The Invisible Networks Behind Everything You Own.

hook.text: A single iPhone requires materials from 43 countries and components from 200+ suppliers.

buildup.text: Modern supply chains break production into stages spread across the globe.

discovery.text: This fragmentation maximizes efficiency: each stage happens where it's cheapest and best.

twist.text: COVID exposed the fragility. A semiconductor shortage in Taiwan shut down car factories in Detroit.

climax.text: Supply chains are the nervous system of globalization.

punchline.text: Everything you own is proof that no country is self-sufficient.

quiz.question: What vulnerability did COVID reveal about global supply chains?
